instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: It had a dead short to ground  at <CAPACITOR>C7804</CAPACITOR> which is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL>.  I injected 3 volts to find it.  now <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is 0v.  do i need to replace to capacitor or no?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Board should start without it.
However, I recommend to solder another cap, once you get the board working.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is fluctuating quickly from 2.5v to 3.1v. could that be why <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> isn't there?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7680</TRANSISTOR> and it boots fine now

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: could the usb-c ribbon cause <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> to fluctuate?  the rail shorted again and had the replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7680</TRANSISTOR>. now <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> fluctuates sporadically from 2.0v to 3.1v.  could this be a ribbon issue?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: You can discard testing with known good one...

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: could the pmic cause the <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> rail to fluctuate like that?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Still missing <SIGNAL>1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>?
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> are stable?

Inspect for corrosion between <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7680</TRANSISTOR>.
Pay atention to <RESISTOR>R7691</RESISTOR>/97/98/99.
Also check <RESISTOR>R7685</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7689</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: the <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> rail became stable but then after running the configurator i started getting 6.8 volts on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> afterwards .  i get 3.3v without <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> on the board  and 20v on the amp meter. how is this possible without <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> on the board?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Did you apply power without <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>, but <TRANSISTOR>Q7660</TRANSISTOR>/80 soldered on the board???
You are very lucky if none of them got burnt.
Do NOT do that again ever in your life!!!

Did you check all above mentioned?
Is the board still booting?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: no it doesn't boot. <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> was shorting the <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> rail and was removed.  Does the <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> have to be there for <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> to work?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Oops...
<CHIP>U7800</CHIP> is the PMU chip (Power Management Unit).
It provides basic voltages to T2.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: i'm getting no voltage for <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and it isn't shorted. does that mean that <CHIP>U7560</CHIP> needs replacing?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Did you even check if <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> gets correct power and enable signal?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: i checked the circuit and it's just not producing <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>. i don't want to put on a new PMIC until i get that rail working. do you know where i can get a new tps51980b?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Be sure to use TPS51980B there; NOT the A version.

On this board <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> enable input is left floating.
All other boards where TPS51980A is specified, enable signal is driven high to enable it.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is missing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: ok thank you. I'll need to hunt down the correct chip
